items.title: CTP Portable Website
items.description: As part of the ctpHomeHacks hackathon, I collaborated with our team's UX designer to develop this landing page for a task management app we proposed. We wanted to make the site as fun and lively as possible with  different animated elements.

items.title: NYC Data Visualization Project
items.description: As part of a research project for my PHYS 1002ID class (Introduction to Physics of Natural Disasters), I developed this heatmap showing the percentage of buildings constructed before 1995 by school districts in New York City. I merged datasets from the NYC Departments of Buildings and City Planning to ensure a total of 1,073,550 buildings to study.

items.title: HSL-RGB Color Picker
items.description: This front-end only tool allows to preview, save, edit and remove color references. Sliders adjust their colors dynamically so the user gets an idea of how the color will look.

items.title: Responsive Gym Website
items.description: As the final project for my CST 2309 (Web Development) class on Fall 2019, I developed this responsive site using Bootstrap and CSS media queries, as well as native HTML, CSS and Javascript.

items.title: Minesweeper
items.description: I enjoy rebuilding classic games and learning the logic behind them. I implemented the flood fill algorithm to reveal all empty cells around the one selected by the player.
